data.text: @whysodirtyharry @YouAreLobbyLud Closing them last year with delta and low vax was appropriate. They are safe, vax has assured this. No one seems to care my 3yr old hasn’t been masked at daycare for the last 2yrs. In any case, the original tweet had nothing to do with safety, it’s about transmission dynamics.

@AndrewWalkom @YouAreLobbyLud Ahh yes, the binary view. I see you didn't say 'keeping schools open safely'. That's the point. You don't understand the argument. No one wants schools to shut, they want them kept open because they are safe.

@CureCFS @Susan29191404 @YouAreLobbyLud @Fiona_M_Russell Obviously infections in the community are community infections but children/schools are not super-spreading as per Fiona RusselI & team/research reports. If children are wearing masks/home learning the community should be subject to greater measures.
@AndrewWalkom @Susan29191404 @YouAreLobbyLud @Fiona_M_Russell What's the difference between higher cases and driving community transmission?

@CureCFS @Susan29191404 @YouAreLobbyLud @Fiona_M_Russell Cases are higher w/ schools open vs closed. The impact has more to do with what the rest of the community is doing e.g lockdown, protections etc. Schools have not been shown to be a significant driver of community transmission to the extent some would have you believe.

@AndrewWalkom @Susan29191404 @YouAreLobbyLud @Fiona_M_Russell Saying there's no surge right after a surge already happened doesn't show that cases aren't higher with schools open vs. closed. Not even comparing the same subject.

@whysodirtyharry @YouAreLobbyLud Keeping schools open has been the preferred position by essentially every Paediatric medical group in the world. In Australian it has by supported by the RACP, ASID, NCIRS, Australia tertiary Paediatric hospitals etc. it’s hardly a minority view.
@Susan29191404 @RettopNoj @YouAreLobbyLud @Fiona_M_Russell provides a medically/research informed reply and people attack the messenger rather than provide evidence that shows the contrary.

@Susan29191404 @YouAreLobbyLud Omicron & people infecting each other at home and community. Schools were closed over Dec/Jan when case surged and despite the panic, cases in the community haven’t surged with return to school. This is what @Fiona_M_Russell has been providing evidence for. Prove her wrong.
